cont.entity_a: Slicing smoothly without tearing meat. Edges are sharp but can dull quickly.
cont.entity_b: Blades are sharp, modern looking. Require effort to cut meat. Hold an edge well.

cont.entity_a: Not the sharpest knives; one had a pronounced bent edge. Quality has declined over the years.
cont.entity_b: Knives are smaller than expected. Knives are sturdy, sharp, and attractive for formal settings.

cont.entity_a: Handles are wood, can be rough and require oiling. Handles are not finished well, feel like raw wood.
cont.entity_b: One-piece design, comfortable and durable with no risk of loosening. Handles are shiny and show fingerprints easily.

Maintenance.comm: Knives stay sharp and maintain edge.

cont.entity_a: Require occasional honing. Must be hand washed to prevent damage. Wood handles can splinter after washing.
Quality control issues noted with bent tips and loose rivets.
Not the same quality as original Chicago Cutlery knives, admitted by the company. Matches older Chicago Cutlery knives.
cont.entity_b: Knives are not as sharp as other brands but look good with flatware.

cont.entity_a: Great value for everyday use, well-suited for everyday cutting needs.

cont.entity_b: Storage case is poorly made, knives can fall out if turned over. Beautiful presentation box, but hinges broke after few uses. Storage box is not durable.
Excellent customer service, addressed order issues promptly.
